summary.Title: Security and Compliance Officer
summary.Presentation:
Do you believe that going to work every day should be fun? At Umbraco, we do.

As UMBRACO’s CMS serves larger and larger clients the demands for security and compliance increase.

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Do you believe that going to work every day should be fun? At Umbraco, we do.

As UMBRACO’s CMS serves larger and larger clients the demands for security and compliance increase.

Therefore we are looking for a Security and Compliance Officer to head and develop Umbraco’s activities within Security and Compliance.

Qualifications

The most important qualification is your personality: who you are, what values and attitudes you have, and how you interact with and behave towards other people.

You have the right stuff if you:

  • Have a take charge and friendly personality
  • Feel comfortable with taking responsibility for your own and your co-workers tasks
  • Are structured when it comes to task and team management
  • Are hungry for knowledge and willing to keep improving yourself
  • Present solutions rather than problems
  • Thrive in a company where things move fast
  • Your communication skills in English - written and spoken - are at an advanced or native level.
The purpose of the role

To head and develop Umbraco’s activities within Security and Compliance. You will have the overall responsibility for the intersection between IT security, information security / cybersecurity and IT risk management.

As a SCO, you must further develop and maintain digital security, and it will be your responsibility to ensure that changes in area related policies are reflected in the internal security mechanisms and controls and subsequently implemented.

Main activities
  • Primary Go-to for security and compliance
  • Responsible for analyzing and reacting to incoming security-issues
  • Coordination of 3. Parties (pentests, etc)
  • Proactive in analyses, risk-profiling and enhancements on all our products and platforms
  • Ensure compliance across the company
  • Coordinate with DPO regarding GDPR
Your background
  • Relevant IT-education + experience with Standards (ISO27001, SOC2, etc), GDPR and other compliance related
  • Background/Experience with software development
  • Experience in technical security and information security
  • Experience in DevOps and automating security testing
  • Experience with CVE-registry

Work from anywhere

We have a work from anywhere policy, however in this role we expect you to be at our HQ in Odense some days per week.

How to apply

Hit apply below.

You will improve your chances significantly by reading about Umbraco on our different media platforms.

details.FormattedPurpose:
Do you believe that going to work every day should be fun? At Umbraco, we do.

As UMBRACO’s CMS serves larger and larger clients the demands for security and compliance increase.

Therefore we are looking for a Security and Compliance Officer to head and develop Umbraco’s activities within Security and Compliance.

Qualifications

The most important qualification is your personality: who you are, what values and attitudes you have, and how you interact with and behave towards other people.

You have the right stuff if you:

  • Have a take charge and friendly personality
  • Feel comfortable with taking responsibility for your own and your co-workers tasks
  • Are structured when it comes to task and team management
  • Are hungry for knowledge and willing to keep improving yourself
  • Present solutions rather than problems
  • Thrive in a company where things move fast
  • Your communication skills in English - written and spoken - are at an advanced or native level.
The purpose of the role

To head and develop Umbraco’s activities within Security and Compliance. You will have the overall responsibility for the intersection between IT security, information security / cybersecurity and IT risk management.

As a SCO, you must further develop and maintain digital security, and it will be your responsibility to ensure that changes in area related policies are reflected in the internal security mechanisms and controls and subsequently implemented.

Main activities
  • Primary Go-to for security and compliance
  • Responsible for analyzing and reacting to incoming security-issues
  • Coordination of 3. Parties (pentests, etc)
  • Proactive in analyses, risk-profiling and enhancements on all our products and platforms
  • Ensure compliance across the company
  • Coordinate with DPO regarding GDPR
Your background
  • Relevant IT-education + experience with Standards (ISO27001, SOC2, etc), GDPR and other compliance related
  • Background/Experience with software development
  • Experience in technical security and information security
  • Experience in DevOps and automating security testing
  • Experience with CVE-registry

Work from anywhere

We have a work from anywhere policy, however in this role we expect you to be at our HQ in Odense some days per week.

How to apply

Hit apply below.

You will improve your chances significantly by reading about Umbraco on our different media platforms.
